text: If the applicant's credit score is above 700 and their income is greater than $50,000, approve the loan.
If the applicant's credit score is below 600 or their debt-to-income ratio is above 50%, deny the loan.
If the applicant has been employed for less than 2 years, but has a co-signer with a credit score above 700, approve the loan.
If the applicant has a history of missed payments but has been steadily employed for the past year, offer a higher interest rate on the loan.
If the applicant is seeking a loan for a vehicle older than 10 years, deny the loan.
If the applicant has a bankruptcy or foreclosure in the past 5 years, deny the loan.
If the applicant has a credit score between 600 and 700, but has a down payment of at least 20%, approve the loan.
If the applicant is seeking a loan for a commercial vehicle, require a larger down payment and offer a shorter loan term.
If the applicant has outstanding student loans, but their income-to-debt ratio is below 30%, approve the loan with a lower interest rate.
If the applicant has a credit score below 500, deny the loan outright.
